content.introduction:
Disallow octal literals
âœ…RecommendedUsing therecommendedconfig from@eslint/jsin aconfiguration fileenables this rule
Table of ContentsRule DetailsCompatibilityVersionResources
Octal literals are numerals that begin with a leading zero, such as:
constnum=071;// 571Copy code to clipboard
Because the leading zero which identifies an octal literal has been a source of confusion and error in JavaScript code, ECMAScript 5 deprecates the use of octal numeric literals.
